body:
Hello,
Recently, we have decided to update the official ruleset for the network.

https://avicus.net/rules
Please be aware of the changes; additions & removals of some rules.
Thanks,
Senior staff.
body_tagged:
Hello,
Recently, we have decided to update the official ruleset for the network.

https://avicus.net/rules
Please be aware of the changes; additions & removals of some rules.
Thanks,
Senior staff.
title: Rules have been updated

replies.body: Can you explain the rule before very last one, I didn't understand anything
replies.body_tagged: Can you explain the rule before very last one, I didn't understand anything

replies.body: If by "the rule before the very last one", you mean Rule E3 — it means that if you reserve a scrimmage server and can't access it because it's broken or glitched, or if certain features don't work properly or as you'd expected, neither the staff nor the server as a whole are required to make up for your loss (for instance, they won't grant you another reservation, because they're not obligated to).
replies.body_tagged: If by "the rule before the very last one", you mean Rule E3 — it means that if you reserve a scrimmage server and can't access it because it's broken or glitched, or if certain features don't work properly or as you'd expected, neither the staff nor the server as a whole are required to make up for your loss (for instance, they won't grant you another reservation, because they're not obligated to).

replies.body:
No, it's simply to inform users that we made changes to fix the vague language that was present before. We have since re-written certain rules in order to fix that issue. From now on we're hoping to be more flexible with rule changes, as in the past we have taken too long to update the page.

EDIT: Wow I just got double ninja'd, do I get a prize?!

replies.body:
That note is there not because the scrim servers have frequent issues, but because in the event that something does go wrong and it isn't able to perform up to spec, users don't expect compensation (it's a free service and accidents happen). Please report any issues if you see them to avicus.net/issues as normal - I'm not presently aware of anything major regarding the scrim servers, so please enlighten me on what is needing attention there.

Yes, there are many small things that need to be addressed. "Small things" from your perspective may equate to enormous changes from a dev's perspective. Most issues that are small from our perspective are in fact fixed quickly. We understand any frustration coming from dedicated users who are seeking something new from Avicus. The lack of progress bothers us too! We want Avicus to thrive and much of what is preventing it is just that. Hold tight I guess.

Edit: You can always drop me an email, keenan@avicus.net, that's the best way to get my attention.

Yes, there are many small things that need to be addressed. "Small things" from your perspective may equate to enormous changes from a dev's perspective. Most issues that are small from our perspective are in fact fixed quickly. We understand any frustration coming from dedicated users who are seeking something new from Avicus. The lack of progress bothers us too! We want Avicus to thrive and much of what is preventing it is just that. Hold tight I guess.

Edit: You can always drop me an email, keenan@avicus.net, that's the best way to get my attention.
